bow: is there any way to describe how painful birth is is it terrifying the whole time you are pregnant knowing you have to endure pain does your body ever go back to normal am not pregnant and not ready to be for years still but these are questions can not flat out ask people would like some real uncensored look into just how painful it is for woman and how her body responds before during and after thank you so much everyone it is still so crazy to me that every one of you had such drastically different experience with the same resulting feeling that it worth it if you get an epidural its really not that bad it was lot less painful than expected lots of women do it you can do it too this is loaded question it is so different for every person and every pregnancy my approach with my first and now my second is that labor and delivery is inevitable fear is pointless you do your best to be healthy and take it one day at time gave birth to my first unmedicated which is what wanted and it was an amazing experience that hope to repeat with my second as far as my body going back to normal no was slightly underweight prior to getting pregnant gained normal amount of weight and was close to my pre pregnancy weight pretty soon afterwards and yet my clothes fit totally differently then got hit with some bad anxiety depression and my weight shot up got pregnant with my second at the same weight was when gave birth the first time and it much rougher on my body this time around though not gaining as much this time before pregnancy did really have to work that hard personally to maintain my weight but it was damn hard after coupled with the mental health issues and plan to really need to re commit myself after baby is born thanks for the long response it true fear is pointless but when you have anxiety as sure you re familiar with it can be really hard to think that way may ask if you suffered post partum depression that another thing worry about ve heard when you push with an epidural you rip more is this true sorry if that too graphic doubt it but suppose its possible the real question is can you handle the pain most women ca and opt for the epidural was extremely thankful for it because the pain became unbearable you can always try to go without it and see how well you do recommend doing lot of practicing reading research if you are going to try to go without it think you have better chance of being successful if you have plan for pain management yep diagnosed with anxiety when was 15 so very familiar for me personally meditation guided meditation and visualizations are very powerful used the hypnobirthing method with my son and highly recommend it having supportive partner who is patient and dedicated to open honest communication and who encourages me to get the help support need through therapy and regular time for myself has been absolutely key as well for me was always apprehensive about being in labor but one way or another the baby was coming out you ca let fear consume you plus after swelling heartburn fatigue etc labor could come soon enough for me the pain was challenging but had completely natural birth went in with the attitude that would try but if needed an epidural that was cool too regretted my decision briefly about 30 minutes before pushing the weird thing is know it was painful and know it was tiring but the only thing really remember is the relief felt after delivered healthy baby your body will never be the same again 9months later am 20lbs below my pre pregnancy weight and none of my old clothes fit none of my really old clothes would fit either my hips are way wider okay most women ca is just plain bullshit all for people having the choice to do whatever they please but the human species would not have survived as long as it has if it were dependent on epidurals saying that women ca do it is nothing short of fear mongering saying most women get epidurals ignores statistics from most everywhere but the us at the beginning of my first pregnancy was scared of labor and delivery however as it got closer to time became less scared and more ready to just be done with it was pretty uncomfortable by the end especially since my first was summer baby for me there is no describing the pain was induced and my body had no trouble letting the pitocin do it job would not recommend that to anybody wanted to do natural birth but it just was possible with the induction ended up with section failure to progress which was whole different animal than labor healed very well from the section and went on to do it again and will yet again in march am very small person 100 lbs got back down to my pre pregnancy weight plus about 5lbs but clothes fit differently think they fit better have hips now for lot of women that ve observed they look better post pregnancy than they did before did not get lot of stretch marks or anything with either kid what did get faded after few months the only lasting mark on me is my section scar and even that is bad pregnancy labor and birth will cause you to realize that you are much stronger than you ever thought possible your body can create and nurture life and that an amazing thing it seems like most people fear the actual birth part when labor is what sucks when you get to the birth part you re mostly relieved to be at that point and say that as someone who pushed for two hours here http www reddit com askreddit comments 2icgt1 what would you like described to you that you can cl0xpb9 is my ~birth story~ as written for similar askreddit question there are lots of replies there as well from other women my labor was pretty difficult 45 hours ended in section and still 30 pounds up from pre pregnancy my body is nowhere close to where it used to me my muscle is gone still have pains in my stomach from the section year+ later and ve suffered from post partum depression but it worth it it sounds cheesy and stupid and like something that would incite rage in the childfree community but feel like my life is complete now can imagine my life 10 15 20 years from now my daughter is awesome she jumps up in down in her bed in the morning because she excited to see me so many moments that make it all worth it and honestly pregnancy can be such an annoyance tiredness peeing all the time body size hunger etc that really did spend much time thinking about how might be in pain for day in few months hah think this has more to do with getting an episiotomy than an epidural fwiw many docs do do episiotomies anymore because it often causes more tearing than necessary think about tearing piece of paper that already has tear in it vs one that does yeah also the pain from pitocin was doing fine with the pain until was put on pitocin 24+ hours after water breaking had to speed things up that was brutal for me the regular labor pain was pretty damn painful but nowhere near pitocin pain was induced and have heard the pain is lot more intense than natural birth stupid me thought no big deal can handle it nope worst pain ever hubs tried to rub my back and hold my hand yelled at him get your fucking hands off me of course felt bad afterwords but holy shit begged for an epidural after that and it was easy peasy when told my ob wanted to start trying for believe his comment was forgot about the pain huh 22 weeks along fearing labor as did before but know there drug help and in the end that little ball of love is totally worth it have you considered seeing therapist before conceiving it sounds like you have some anxiety issues you re aware of and it could be helpful to have healthy coping strategies and support structure in place pre pregnancy it hurts lot but the thing that got me through it was that it was continuous for me it came in waves breathing through the pain helped until got my drugs eight hours in the first time much quicker the second time it was not lamaze breathing deep focused breathing more like yoga just did focused breathing while labored but would highly recommend hypnobabies it the same idea focus movement through the experience was afraid of what it would be like as my due date approached then went overdue by days and by the end of it was just ready to be done looking back it such tiny part of the whole new parent ordeal you go through remember the weeks of intense sleep deprivation the sleep deprivation continues after that but not quite as intensely being much much more challenging than labor itself but did have an epidural so that helped deleted everyone birth and postpartum recovery is different for me there very easy way to describe the pain not that bad never felt need for medication does that happen for everyone obviously not and there were things that helped mostly the hot water and that because of my career very practiced at controlling my breathing and mental state under stress also gained very little weight only 15lbs above where started in part because lost so much to nausea in the first half and combined with the easy labor was back to my basic size quite quickly however just like anything that you stretch out it never going to be exactly the same do work out and so my waist is definitely thicker than it was before and have squishier stomach think that could definitely be largely remedied if ever actively worked on it can still wear all my old clothes but they do fit as loosely as before as far as being afraid of it yeah it always going to make one nervous to go through an experience that *could* kill you and that will hurt to some extent but by the time you get to the last few weeks of pregnancy the anticipation has built up so much and or you re so uncomfortable already that worry is not the only emotion once you re in labor you do have much extra brain space to be scared and yes epidurals can make labor longer make it more difficult to push again not every woman or the protocols surrounding getting one would probably be different studies have been done showing that epidurals cause no difference in birth outcome would look those up for you but you can just google them chose to get an epidural because why experience pain if you do have to and there is higher incidence of post partum depression in women who elected to not have an epidural and wanted to do everything could to avoid ppd did rip like hell fourth degree tear do do google image search you will never want to have baby but am small woman and my baby was over pounds that ripping would have hurt hell of lot more without an epidural it totally varies from person to person for some people it not that bad at all just here to provide counterpoint for me personally it was genuinely 36 hours of hell was writhing in agony just about the entire time crying screaming vomiting begging them to give me pain relief it was so much worse than imagined and had an epidural it helped lot but the pain was still off the charts maybe it because have small frame and had an pound baby probably the pitocin caused the majority of the pain my body is more or less normal again and has been since about months post partum there are some changes though for one thing it takes time for your abdominal muscles to snap back after having been stretched out so far still do have the abdominal strength that had before but have had time to work out per se just walking with baby in stroller or carrier edit my hips are slightly wider too which changes my gait little ve had three with an epidural one without not by choice there just was time with the drugs it was great happy times cracking jokes no tearing and it did interfere with my labor progress at all the thing is every woman is going to have different experience for every person with good epidural experience there will be someone who hated it there just no way to know how it will turn out for you labor is just small tiny moment compared to the joy of raising child it sounds cheesy but it true contractions for me were like the worst constipation you can imagine combined with the worst period cramps you ve ever had multiplied by 10 had about 10 hours of those before was admitted to the hospital and got my epidural after that had zero pain and mean zero the nurses told me still feel the ring of fire when she crowned nope not thing had completely pain free delivery with only 40 minutes of pushing felt pressure and knew when to push and how but the pain was totally gone to the point where my biggest concern was getting enough oxygen and not passing out recovery was not bad at all my lady parts were right back to normal within months so here is just one story out of billions of birth experiences it was eh not particularly strong or brave or pain tolerant do like the dentist but ve survived tattoos was induced with pitocin at 42 weeks which was told was the devil and was terrified of it apparently had back labor which apparently is worse but do have anything to compare it to it was work wow they do call it laboring for nothing holy moly was it effort did do any pain meds feeling numb is scarier for me than feeling pain so just went with sitting on ball using water and having my husband press so hard on my back he needed physical therapy afterward seriously but never rated my pain above which is on its own useless but the whole time thought ok prepare for the worst but the worst just never came suddenly it was time to push which for me felt fantastic it was very satisfying to push and there was just minute or two of real burning pain in the whole hour of pushing and then it was done so it was certainly painful but not like how imagined and not the worst pain ever felt privilege which goes to chemical burn on my eyeball my post pregnancy body is normal body it different sure but this is what normal body that has done what it needed to do looks like and am fine with it deleted deleted it like really bad period cramps that come in horrible waves and get worse and worse then you feel like you ve got to take big poop if you get an epidural it easy peasy ve been told both my births were unusal as they were both quick and very easy probably not the best person to answer if you re looking for horror stories deleted actively avoided getting pregnant because of my fear of labor then got knocked up at 38 and regret being so scared birth story here http www reddit com mommit comments 2iq5jy being induced cl4id3s attended hypnobirthing classes which thought were cheesey at the time but totally recommend no epidural no painkillers no gas and air *nada* btw was induced and on pitocin drip for 12 hours pushed six times in 20 minutes and boom baby almost felt traumatized at how quickly it happened no ring of fire no hours of increasing pain it was like the world worst stomach flu spent so much time preparing for the worst that reality was so much better than could have imagined we have very similar story labored at home for 47 hours before being transferred and ended up having section little guy was sunny side up was yours posterior too you are right in it being beyond worth all of it would repeat my terrible labor monthly just to have my perfect little monkey around every woman experience is different there is so much exciting and weird stuff going on during pregnancy that really did even think about the labor until few weeks before my due date as others have said fear of something inevitable is pointless after 42 weeks was actually looking forward to it just to have the pregnancy be over with and to meet our lo to put it in perspective even if you have very long painful labor it is so fleeting compared to the number of hours in the years of your life and the first time your baby smiles and coos at you it becomes an even foggier memory my experience was at worst on my to 10 pain scale only started to ask about an epidural once was already fully dilated and so ended up delivering 20 minutes later without so much as tylenol was so afraid of the pain but was hell bent on not getting an epidural when the time came it was no worse then having really bad flu where you re puking and when the head comes out that pretty painful when was teenager stretched my ears incorrectly with taper quickly and its the worst burning pain same thing on your hoo ha but knowing that was done being pregnant is was got me through the night and also napped between intense contractions omg for my first had heard about the ring of fire and when he was about to crown the doc told me might feel some pressure more than few curses were uttered obviously everyone birth experience is very different for me the biggest issues came from things was not prepared for despite reading as many books as could get my hands on and taking birthing class was not prepared for back labor every bit of pain experienced was in my back mine was head down face up so the hard part of his noggin was right on my tailbone this is very tmi but was also not prepared for my ladybits to have the same sensation sensitivity guess thought the pressure and swelling would numb it up bit nope when the midwife sticks her hand in there it feels like there is hand in there lol labored at home with no meds for 47 hours before transferring to the hospital because stopped dilating at cm ended with section the epidural got once arrived was amazing would never go drug free again suffered the weepy baby blues and some depression after sought help and recovered quickly am just about back to my prepregancy weight my old clothes fit but they fit very differently my tummy still has pooch almost 11 months later went weeks past my due date so have some crazy stretchmarks will definitely never wear bikini again but my boobs held up nicely after nursing so have that going for me pregnancy sucks labor sucks recovering is awful but that little dude who said his first word just yesterday lt is worth every last second of it all and would not hesitate to do it again just for him edit to answer your other question was not too concerned about the labor until the last couple of weeks even then was more concerned with tearing than the pain of the contractions completely agree with you on the sleep deprivation it is hard to understand what every hours around the clock for weeks feels like until you are doing it man that part was rough gt it different sure but this is what normal body that has done what it need to do looks like and am fine with it this really like this yep sunny side up plus early water break had high fever at the end of labor amp needed double blood transfusion after section but totally worth it try to look at it his way when it gets closer to the time you re going to be tired sore and big you ll be looking forward to it happening little more than you were in the begining even just little bit think the real question is can you handle the pain when you know that there is less painful option who knows what women in the past would have done if they had the option guarantee most women who endured twilight birth would have preferred something else it reminds me of the episode of call the midwife where the doctor who is on call for the births gets new gas and air machine and becomes non stop busy going out to the homes of laboring women who pretend like they ca handle it so that they can have the pain relief ve done it twice both times with epidurals the first time hurt lot because my water broke and baby was malpositioned so had to labor naturally for like hours before was dilated enough for the epidural then the epidural wore off and my doctor told the nurses not to top me off because it was time to push the pain was really bad at the time but it temporary you know it hard to remember how painful it was now but know it was pretty bad and pushed for an hour and half wanted to watch my baby be born in mirror and feel the head but when the nurses tried to remind me to do those things told them was in too much pain to do them so kind of missed out on that the second time waited too long to get the epidural but only had to endure about an hour of pain before got it then it was just blissful and everything ever dreamed about in birth was cm when had it done and when was checked an hour later was 10 the nurse had me labor down for an hour then after the doctor got there pushed my ten pound four ounce baby out in two contractions there was no pain at all except during crowning and that pain elicited verbal ow ow from me ve had worse pain from stubbing my toe got to watch her be born in mirror touch the head etc was chatting and laughing with everyone the whole time as for the body was fat to begin with but even after losing all the weight my clothes fit differently ended up losing more weight than gained so still looked better overall oh man posterior was the worst had an epidural both times but just tiny one stitch tears even with ten pounder depends on many factors like where you live and your education level in the us the rate is 60 overall according to the cdc http www vbac com 2011 04 cdc reports most women receive epidural or spinal anesthesia for labor pain would bet in countries where gas and air are available the rate is pretty low do have horror story my water broke at 37 weeks got put on pitocin and could tolerate the pain just fine the only reason opted for the epidural is because was scared that might need it later and it would ve been too late lol yea guess pussied out the pitocin did slow down my labor which the doctor was afraid of few hours later the nurse checked me and said she could feel the babies head yikes time to push pushed for 20 minutes and that was it think the worst part of it all was getting the iv in my arm guess all pregnancies are different can confirm induced contractions are more intense stronger with less time between to rest laboured spontaneously and med free with the first induction with the second was begging for an epidural hours into active labour do know about you but really miss my brain used to be mediumly smart years ago before the sleep deprivation yr old just started sleeping through now but breastfeeding wk old negates that ca get full sentences out sometimes our creator was smart enough to make the third trimester so unbelievably uncomfortable that you want the baby out and do really think or care about the pain of child birth until the actual moment does it hurt hell yes but few months go by and you ca recall it being as painful as it was my hips felt like they were breaking apart will your body ever go back to normal probably not 100 have some stretch marks but do really notice them my vagina seems to be normal odd enough the sex was better after lo and yes my tummy is as firm but it okay ll work harder to stay in shape no way to describe it as it is different for everyone personally giving birth naturally both times was easy for me let my body take over and my brain checked out everything is so different for everyone had my first baby at 16 so really pushed my body and it never was the same but do even know how my fully mature before kids body was meant to look like gained 50 lbs from 100 to 150 with my first but lost weight with my second from 145 to 113 even my experiences with pregnancy were very diverse but really enjoyed all of it the glow long healthy hair seeing my babies for the first time even our hospital stay it sounds lot more crazy talking about it than it is actually going though it the pain and actual childbirth are inevitable so really did fear it so much remember when was in labour at home after being induced that had conversation with my husband that if anything happened did want to be vegetable that was it also my pregnancy was just hideous had hyperemesis and was sick until well into my seventh month which is when started to get pelvic girdle pain so was just so glad to get it over with but it was worth it would do it all again in heartbeat to get the boy he just over two now and adding him to our family has made me happier than ever thought possible my body months post partum is back to pre pregnancy weight but everything fits differently my boobs are huge for the first time in my life and grew an ass used to be called no butt feydid by family members now got junk in the trunk as for the pain of childbirth 21+ hours of hell pain like had never felt before pressure in places did know existed inside myself but its different kind of pain some call it productive pain focused solely on that thought for the hours of pushing did kept telling myself that this is means to an end and that my baby would be here at the end of it like doing an endurance run or marathon you push through the end no matter how badly it hurts your body screaming for relief and at the end of it you get the best prize ever we are lucky creatures that we can not remember pain as we remember smell or any other sensation if we did we would never get pregnant again and it is spot on when people say the pain fades into hazy memory very quickly the oxytocin dump the moment you give the final push and the baby is out and you hear that first wail is the best high have ever had in my life and in my younger days smoked some fantastic pot so that saying lot it is terrifying if you allow the fear of the pain to consume you we all make it through one way or another and many of us go on to spawn more little magic creatures every single woman since the beginning of time has gone through the same pains of childbirth to some degree it kind of solidarity and comfort to know that ppd is one thing worried about most throughout pregnancy and sure enough got it but my now husband and were prepared we stayed on top of my symptoms and both agreed when it was time to talk to my ob about it was put on zoloft and after just week started feeling million times better more capable know it is harder for some to find that place but feel lot of it is mindset being prepared and being self aware did you ever lay on your stomach right after you had baby number so weird deleted used to sleep on my stomach lot but find it incredibly uncomfortable after having baby for some reason also used hypnobabies with amazing success with both of my children did it right after had my daughter and think it because your abdominal muscles and organs are still moving back in place kept reminding myself that if it was that bad no one would have second third or sixth children lol was pressured into having an epidural when gave birth so for me it was lot of sitting around and waiting until the real action happened the recovery was significantly worse than the delivery tore very badly so was basically healing the same as surgical procedure ca wait to do it again and do it for real this time for me having the epidural made me feel very detached from the whole process which is not what wanted it might be exactly what someone else needs but it ruined the day for me and caused lot of mental issues which whole other story this time looking forward to pushing myself through the pain and letting my body experience delivery as think it supposed to need that to have closure think since my first birth was kinda traumatic to me physically and psychologically obviously this is rare but my aunt had zero labour pains she felt pressure like if she had to poop and delivered my cousin in the bathroom so mean that be cool too haha ugh the pitocin made me vomit so much really really hate to throw up think the pitocin from birth was worse than the unmedicated labor and delivery from birth for me ve had two unmedicated births using hypnobabies method and reading ina may gaskin guide to childbirth highly recommend both ina may book has one half positive birth stories and you get healthy idea of how birth is different for everyone for example some women hate the pushing part some women love the pushing part crazy bitches the second half tells you what going on with labor how it all works together and loads of tips and tricks to make labor easier and more effective example keep loose mouth jaw you ca keep loose bottom with tight mouth she huge huge figure in midwifery and its great read for you and your partner hypnobabies helps with anxiety and relaxation it kind of stupid when you start but fuck it works silly things like changing your wording helps do think pain say pressure it not hard it strong and so on if you go in saying lots of negative words chances are you ll have negative experience it mind game the cds help you zone out and relax was 7cm and nodding off experienced doula could tell when was having pressure waves contractions you get to point between awake and asleep you know everything going on around you you just stop giving fuck so we re my births painful the dilating part no but they were wildly uncomfortable the pushing part yes tore both times first with little numbing shot second tore my labia and nothing barely doctor in the room it does last long but recovery blows hate it way more than labor would choose natural birth again without batting an eye again lot of it is mind game it surrendering when you want to fight or flight it relaxing when you want to clinch it trusting when you are scared to death everyone says you do get trophy for it but fuck that have two trophies two achievements unlocked two mountains climbed two amazing experiences that make me feel strong incredible and proud of my body *experiences may vary* important thing to remember is that even though it cliche it true all pregnancies are different my 1st was dream my 2nd was nightmare also you ll forget the pain when the baby is born that bullshit that something we tell new moms so they do freak out you ll remember it but promise you ll decide it was worth it labor for me was bad my 1st one was induced and controlled when got the epidural the first one only worked on one side of my body and had to have another the person who put in my 1st epi was awful and could feel the needle digging around the 2nd epi was awesome she had the old one out and the new one in so fast did know it always asked how will know when in labor just kept getting you ll know such bullshit cop out being in labor at least for me was like the worst cramps you ve ever had only deeper they wo go away no matter what position you re in once the epi was in was 100 fine no pain had energy was ready to go baby only pushed times and he came no long drawn out labor for me lot of women say they were at the pushing stage for hours even my nurse told me not to expect it to go fast when she said it was time to push but was never in pain they gave me clicker to control when got med boost and never felt thing did tear had an episodomy know spelled that wrong but it where the doctor makes cut to prevent tearing this is somewhat controversial some women say it worse some say it better think it depends on your doctor the next day 9am had showered dressed and put on little make up did want to look like mombie in any pics my nurse was shocked had 9lb 10oz baby and she could believe was up and around so quick had some trouble sitting on hard surfaces for about month otherwise all good my 2nd had horrible pregnancy pain pretty much every day had section it was amazing felt no pain was sick as dog had pre eclampsia vomited on the table after he was out though felt perfect the pain after was pretty bad hurt for days my incision was low and could wear jeans for few weeks but nothing so bad could handle it this is so true labor is no walk in the park but it does end you will get through it kept telling myself this during the hardest parts it such short time compared to raising child you soon get over it and almost forget the worst women have babies all the time and if they can do it so can so can you months in and even though can fit into my pre pregnancy clothes my body is not the same the worst is muscular pain in my back in absolute agony sometimes also like the other lady said the pain is inevitable had pethidine and epidural which would both definitely have again was induced it was like bad period cramps but not worse than the bad cramps had in high school got an epidural conveniently right before was able to push so did have much time to enjoy it and the guy did great job could still stand and move around and use my legs they just felt like when you stand outside in winter with pants that are warm enough and you get that weird numb feeling the baby ended up being bigger than they anticipated and was facing the wrong way so after hours of pushing the doctor had to do an episiotomy which did feel and pulled the baby out second degree tear took forever to heal and had granulation tissue but that another story and had to lovely opportunity of feeling the stitches since they turned off the epidural and it wore of instantly as in could stand and walk immediately that being said ended up with kidney infection afterwards and had to be rushed back to the hospital the day after was discharged and that was many many times worse than my experience giving birth it was bad enough that when was checked into the er they took my back immediately even though there were people waiting and the people waiting seemed concerned super high fever over 104 with ibuprofen and the kidney pain was insane and then they needed to get clean urine sample so they had to insert catheter it was so messed up down there from having just had baby that they had to get an expert to fish around and find the right spot super duper painful and do recommend it think the nurses looked like they were about to cry and they just kept saying how sorry they were so yeah having baby is ouchy and tiring but rather pop out billion babies and feel the stitches in my lady parts every time than have another kidney infection can you describe what ppd is like it seems like all the things women go through even post birth is intense between body changes and adjusting to completely new life do you think it is worth it to opt for section instead of vaginal birth my mom had section with my brother and says it was such long painful recovery maybe things have changed since hers 24 years ago was the kidney infection related to giving birth indirectly it was caused by them putting catheter in taking it out putting it back in taking it out etc if they just would have left it in there would have been no problem everyone is different for me it was constant anxiety that something bad would happen to her that nothing did could protect her hate being scared and was scared all the time constantly checking to see if she was still breathing it was like being on overdrive 24 was sleeping even if she was was too scared nightmares horrific nightmares was paranoid that someone would take her from me which is exactly unfounded her sperm donor mother is insane and made threats my lo and had rough start with breastfeeding resented her when she shreded my nipples she was hungry and was exhausted hated breastfeeding cry when she would latch on my anxiety made her anxious it just felt terrible all of it hated how felt felt like was bonding with her so talked to my ob got the meds took day off from being me saw some friends and got pedi and haircut grabbed some starbucks and took few deep breaths it can be so hard so overwhelming but the meds kicked in quickly and started to see the light at the end of the tunnel started to relax more and not get so frustrated with the breastfeeding we started to bond and now at months post miss her when at work so much that it hurts in nearly physical way like my chest hurts thinking that could be home cuddling her making her laugh helping her learn watching her sleep so peacefully have had bad day since about months post partum feel confident in of next year love being mom her mom ca really remember what life was like before her do miss the life had before her it rollercoaster of hormones and craziness but for me it has been so very worth it
